jobPostingInfo.title: Robotics Undergraduate Intern, RTAS Testbeds
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

The robotics section at JPL, the place where robots for planetary exploration are born! We engage in research, technology development, and the creation of sophisticated robotic hardware platforms and systems from architectural concept through operations.

Members of this team investigate, plan, build and develop robotic hardware for a wide variety of applications and environments. Robots developed by this team are built to operate from the ice expanses of the Arctic to the crushing depths of Earth’s oceans; from the hellish conditions of Venus, to Mars, to the frozen moons of Enceladus and Europa. Teams apply research to the planning, design, development, and testing of mechanical and/or electromechanical systems for mobility, manipulation, and climbing; sensors; instruments; and controls.

As an intern on the Mars Sample Return (MSR) project, you will be part of the Testbeds team of the Robotic Transfer Assembly System (RTAS), a system being developed to contain samples in Martian orbit for return to Earth. You will be part of an interdisciplinary group of robotics mechanical, electrical, software, and systems engineers which conceives, designs, builds, integrates, and operates the hardware and software systems used to validate and verify (V&V) RTAS development and flight hardware. You will be involved in multiple aspects of testbed design, assembly, integration, & commissioning, as well as test execution at multiple levels of hardware integration. This will be an interdisciplinary role requiring knowledge and skills mostly in robotic mechanical and electrical hardware engineering, while working closely with software and systems engineers.

Qualifications:

  • Must be available to work at least 40 hours/week, in-person, for at least 10 weeks this Summer 2023 (longer duration is welcome up to 16 weeks) with the possibility of continuing to work part-time the proceeding Fall between 8 to 30 hours/weekly.
  • Must be currently enrolled in a college or university pursuing a bachelors, masters, or PhD in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Physics, Robotics, or related technical field. Must be enrolled full time in school following the fall or spring term.
  • Must have a minimum cumulative 3.0 out of a 4.0 GPA
  • Knowledge in one or more of the following areas: robotics, mechanisms, automation systems, systems engineering, controls, autonomy, thermal systems, operation systems, data systems.
  • Recently completed coursework or research providing an understanding and application of standard principles, theories, concepts and techniques in machine design, systems engineering, automation, controls, or robotic systems.
  • General knowledge of applicable industry and/or academic practices and standards in automation systems or systems engineering.

What would help:

  • Experience with robotic manipulators, end effectors, or and/or autonomous robotic systems.
  • Experience with spacecraft flight hardware development and testing.
  • Experience with Linux, Python, LabVIEW, and/or MATLAB.
  • Hands-on development and prototyping experience for machine and/or electrical/electronic systems/products.
  • Experience working with robots or electromechanical systems through education, hobbies, teams, and/or clubs.
  • Ability to thoroughly investigate and resolve anomalies discovered through test
  • Ability to document all development activities and design trades thoroughly, including gathering, interpreting, and communicating technical requirements and design specifications.
  • Experience collecting and analyzing data, and working with experts across different teams.
  • Good verbal and written communications skills with ability to work in a team environment.

The typical hourly rate for this job in Pasadena, California depending on education level is $19 as a freshman, $22 as a sophomore, $26 as a junior, $29 as a senior

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
